docs.snippet: ROCK-AND-ROLL is a sweaty enough enterprise without summer figuring into the picture. Think of it: the long hair, the energy, the jacked-up beat, the floor crammed with writhing, distortion-crazed revelers. Ultimately, the archetypal rock experien...
docs.lead_paragraph: ROCK-AND-ROLL is a sweaty enough enterprise without summer figuring into the picture. Think of it: the long hair, the energy, the jacked-up beat, the floor crammed with writhing, distortion-crazed revelers. Ultimately, the archetypal rock experience for any generation is going into some small, tightly packed club, dancing and losing oneself for an hour or two, and re-emerging sweat-soaked and transformed. The image might not be a pretty one, but there's nothing polite or demure about shared catharsis.

docs.lead_paragraph: SPORTSWRITERS' memoirs are almost always livelier than their original stories; this time around, old scores can be settled and the record finally set aright. When two such stylists as Heywood Hale Broun and W.C. Heinz are retelling the tales, the results are winning.
docs.abstract: Heinz, W C: Once They Heard the Cheers reviewed by Robert Lipsyte

docs.snippet: Controller Coler was heartily cheered last night at the annual dinner of the Colonial Club when he rose to speak to the toast of "Our City." A few of the enthusiastic diners even shouted, "Mayor," "Mayor," thus giving voice to their personal prefe...
docs.lead_paragraph: Controller Coler was heartily cheered last night at the annual dinner of the Colonial Club when he rose to speak to the toast of "Our City." A few of the enthusiastic diners even shouted, "Mayor," "Mayor," thus giving voice to their personal preference for Mr. Coler as a candidate for the Mayoralty.

headline.main: CHEERS FOR MR. COLER; Greeted as "Mayor" at the Colo- nial Club Dinner.

docs.snippet: There were no flying beer cans and jeers for Jeff Gordon on Sunday at California Speedway. It was all cheers and smiles as Gordon, a California native, won his second consecutive Nascar Nextel Cup race.    A week after beating the fan favorite Dal...
docs.lead_paragraph: There were no flying beer cans and jeers for Jeff Gordon on Sunday at California Speedway. It was all cheers and smiles as Gordon, a California native, won his second consecutive Nascar Nextel Cup race. A week after beating the fan favorite Dale Earnhardt Jr. in a controversial finish at Talladega, Gordon dominated on his way to a victory in the Auto Club 500, his third victory in eight races on the two-mile oval. He is the only Cup driver with more than one victory here.
docs.abstract: Jeff Gordon wins Auto Club 500; photo (M)

headline.main: Gordon Wins Again, But to Cheers This Time

docs.lead_paragraph: THE most conspicuous target among the new books is now the foreign policy of the United States of America. This seems to be a main trend of the year. There is general agreement that the three-speed Soviet terror seeping, creeping and leaping must be stopped. There are many differences of vehement opinion on what's to be done and who's to be blamed for not doing...

headline.main: Books of The Times; Advocate of Understanding A Work That Merits Respect 'The Reader's Bible' Is Different

docs.snippet: As Brandi Chastain prepared to hit her first tee shot this morning as part of the JAL Big Apple Classic Pro-Am at the Wykagyl Country Club, the large crowd of mostly soccer fans grew respectfully silent.    Chastain hesitated for a second, then tu...
docs.lead_paragraph: As Brandi Chastain prepared to hit her first tee shot this morning as part of the JAL Big Apple Classic Pro-Am at the Wykagyl Country Club, the large crowd of mostly soccer fans grew respectfully silent. Chastain hesitated for a second, then turned to the crowd and said, ''In soccer, we're used to a lot of noise, so you can make some noise.'' When the crowd did not immediately respond, she said, ''I mean it.''
docs.abstract: Brandi Chastain, Mia Hamm and Julie Foudy, members of US women's soccer team, are playing in JAL Big Apple Classic Pro-Am golf tournament at Wykagyl Country Club in New Rochelle, NY (M)

docs.snippet: Francis Richard Stockton was the guest of honor at a reception by the Authors Club, at its home, in the Carnegie Building, on Thursday evening. The occasion was marked by appreciative tributes to the author and general friendliness to the man. Bot...
docs.lead_paragraph: Francis Richard Stockton was the guest of honor at a reception by the Authors Club, at its home, in the Carnegie Building, on Thursday evening. The occasion was marked by appreciative tributes to the author and general friendliness to the man. Both were expressed in speech and song, and several original poems read in honor of the guest of the evening removed even a suggestion of prosiness.
docs.abstract: Francis Richard Stockton Guest of Honor; John Paul and J. H. Morse's Poems; Letters from Mr. Stedman and Dr. Van Dyke

headline.main: MR. STOCKTON.; Speeches and Poems at a Reception Given to Him by the Authors Club.
